DataElement.preferredName: Patient Serious Negation Healed Injury Ulceration Fracture Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study related to serious non-healing wound, ulcer, or bone fracture.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Serious Negation Healed Injury Ulceration Fracture Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Recovered, restored to healthy condition by natural processes, e.g. by scar formation; freed from illness or injury._Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity._The formation or development of an ulcer._A traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Serious Negation Healed Injury Ulceration Fracture Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Recovered, restored to healthy condition by natural processes, e.g. by scar formation; freed from illness or injury.:Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:The formation or development of an ulcer.:A traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Recovered, restored to healthy condition by natural processes, e.g. by scar formation; freed from illness or injury.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
The formation or development of an ulcer.
A traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
